definition: room/work unit/grave/scabbard/family or clan/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy

sentences.english: Then someone invited me round for a bit of chamber music.
sentences.chinese: 隨後，有人邀請我淺嘗一下室內樂。

sentences.english: A year or so ago, I started to play chamber music.
sentences.chinese: 大約在一年前，我開始演奏室內樂。

sentences.english: I love learning, too, from my chamber music partners.
sentences.chinese: 我也愛從室內樂的夥伴那裏學習。

sentences.english: Chamber music is written for a small group of instrument.
sentences.chinese: 室內樂是爲一小部分樂器而寫的。

sentences.english: Shu Bote injected into the chamber in the traditional spirit of their own characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 舒柏特在傳統的室內樂中注入了自己的精神特性。

sentences.english: These joint undertakings are like,well, you might think of them analogous to playing chamber music with a string quartet.
sentences.chinese: 這種共同行爲，就像是用絃樂四重奏演奏室內樂。

sentences.english: Its history over 50 years has matured the Camerata into one of the best chamber orchestras.
sentences.chinese: 樂團擁有50多年曆史，是世界優秀的室內樂團之一。
世界級水平的室內樂演奏。

definition: part (in multi-part instrumental or choral music), such as the soprano part or bass part
double reed wind instrument (such as oboe or bassoon)
hulusi, aka cucurbit flute (a kind of free reed wind instrument)
Handel (name)/George Frideric Handel (1685-1759), German-born Baroque composer, naturalized British in 1727
